questions.question: Which is NOT a characteristic of an  expressway?

choices.answer: High speed traffic.
Divided by some barrier between   opposing   lanesof travel.
Has a high rate of collisions.
Drivers can enter and exit only at   certain places.

questions.question: Types of interchanges at expressways are called:

choices.answer: Flute, harp and violin
Diamond, trumpet and cloverleaf
Ruby, star and heart.
Bear owl and eagle.

questions.question: Highway safety design features on expressways that help make them safer roadways to travel include:

choices.answer: Concrete pavement.
Breakaway sign supports
Cement Bridge supports.
Advertisement billboards.

questions.question: Which is Not a characteristic of urban roadways?

choices.answer: High volume of traffic
Pedestrians and bicyclists are notpermitted.
Traffic that starts and stopsfrequently.
Multiple intersections with left andright turns.

questions.question: The entrance to an expressway has three areas.  What are they?

choices.answer: The entrance ramp, the accelerationlane and the merge area.
The entrance ramp, the decelerationlane and the merge area.
The exit ramp, the decelerationlane and the change area.
The weave, the speed sign and the curve.

questions.question: When in the acceleration lane getting  ready to get on the expressway, which  of these is important to do?

choices.answer: Stop suddenly if there is no gap tomove into on the expressway.
Stare straight ahead for traffic in thelane.
Do not yield to traffic on theexpressway.
Adjust your speed to create a safefollowing interval.

questions.question: Which of these should you NOT do  when merging onto an expressway?

choices.answer: Selecta gap large enough to fit your vehicle.
Changelanes smoothly.
Changetwo lanes at once and speed up.
Adjust your speed to create a safefollowing interval.

questions.question: Which of the following can be a  potential problem when entering an  expressway?

choices.answer: Bicyclists,pedestrians and mopeds.
Nogap to move into on the expressway.
Notraffic at the merge area.
A long straight stretch of roadway ahead.

questions.question: Some expressway entrances come in  from the left, instead of the usual  right. Why do these present special  problems?

choices.answer: The left lane is usually for higherspeed traffic.
No one can see to the left.
Lane changes to the right are impossible
Parked vehicles on the left shoulder.

questions.question: Driving on the expressway requires  the driver to:

choices.answer: Drive slowly and carefully.
Takepills to stay awake.
Stop often for traffic signals.
Search farther down the roadway (20-30seconds ahead).

questions.question: Some expressways have minimum  speed signs. These signs mean that  you:

choices.answer: Shall not drive slower than the minimumspeed   posted unless conditions require aslower speed
Can drive as slowly as you want.
Can drive as fast as you want.
Speed limits have no effect on yourdriving.

questions.question: Keeping open space around your vehicle  on the expressway is important. When is  it difficult to do this on expressways

choices.answer: When tractor-trailers are on the   expressway.
When it is rush hour, bumper tobumper   traffic.
When pulling a trailer.
When driving at night.

questions.question: A large vehicle following closely behind is a:

choices.answer: Closed sightline to the rear
Closed travel path to the rear
Closedsightline and travel path to the rear
Closed sightline and travel path

questions.question: When parking on the right shoulder of a hill  where there is no curb you should:

choices.answer: Point the front wheels toward thecenter of   the   road
Have the rear wheels closer to theshoulder
Turn the front wheels so they point tothe   side of the road
Place the front wheel parallel to theedge of   the pavement

questions.question: When leaving a parallel parking  space, you

choices.answer: Have the right away.
Can choose to yield to all traffic
Should expect traffic to yield toyou.
Must yield to all approachingtraffic.

questions.question: Over-steering during a lane change  can cause your vehicle to

choices.answer: Turn too sharply into the adjoining lane.
Stabilize during the lane change.
Turn too soon into the adjoininglane.
Turn too late into the adjoining lane.

questions.question: What is the most important step in turning the  car around?

choices.answer: Careful check of traffic in alldirections
Signal
Shift to the proper gear
Select the lane of traffic in which toturn

questions.question: When preparing to make a lane change, what else should you do besides use lane change signal device?

choices.answer: Make a mirror blind area check to the   left or right rear
Slow down a little and check the rear
Show a hand signal and wave everyone   back
Change your lane position

questions.question: When backing to the right, after  checking all around the vehicle, look  to the

choices.answer: Rearview mirror.
Front
Rearand left.
Rear and right.

questions.question: If you must turn your car around on a narrow  street and most of the traffic is coming  toward you, the best type of tur

choices.answer: 3-point or Y-turn
2-point turnabout using a road on the left.
Intersectional U-turn
2-point turnabout using a road on the right

questions.question: In a right turn, where will the rear wheels  ‘track’ in relation to the front wheels?

choices.answer: Farther from the curb
Closer to the curb
It depends on the turn
In the same track

questions.question: Before changing lanes, the most  important thing you should do is:

choices.answer: Signal to communicate with others
Make sure the area and travel path areopen
Change speed to slow vehicles behind
Look in the rearview mirror for vehiclesclose   to you

questions.question: You are able to check the mirror  blind areas by:

choices.answer: Glancing ahead left and right
Using the side-view mirror to check therear
Using both the inside and the outside   mirrors and a head check
Using the inside mirror to check behind

questions.question: A turnabout is a maneuver for

choices.answer: Entering a driveway.
Turning your vehicle completely around.
Steering into a left-hand turn.
An Australian driver.

questions.question: When two vehicles arrive at an  uncontrolled intersection from  different streets:

choices.answer: Driver on the right shall yield to the vehicle   on the left
Driver on the left shall yield tothe vehicle   on   the right
Both vehicles must stop
Neither vehicle must stop
